title: Manchester United plot transfer moves for Boubakary Soumare and Moussa Dembele
text:
Manchester United will bolster Ole Gunnar Solskjaer’s squad in January (Picture: Getty)

Manchester United have expressed interest in signing Ligue 1 stars Boubakary Soumare and Moussa Dembele, according to reports.

Red Devils chief Ed Woodward spent almost £150million last summer to bring Harry Maguire, Aaron Wan-Bissaka and Daniel James to Old Trafford.

While the summer additions have impressed, they have been unable to prevent Manchester United from enduring a poor start to the season, with Ole Gunnar Solskjaer’s side currently seventh in the Premier League.

The Red Devils are interested in signing Boubakary Soumare (Picture: Getty)

The poor run of form has convinced Solskjaer and Woodward that more signings are necessary and Manchester United hope to bring at least four new players in over the next two transfer windows.

Attacking reinforcements are at the top of United’s agenda – with the team scoring more than one goal just twice in the league this season – and ESPN FC say Dembele is a figure of substantial interest.

Advertisement

Advertisement

The 23-year-old has scored 26 goals in 56 games since joining Lyon from Celtic last year and been linked with a number of Premier League clubs.

ESPN also say Manchester United have identified Lille midfielder Soumare as a top target and a possible heir to Paul Pogba, who continues to be linked with a move to Real Madrid.

United have no plans to sell the French World Cup-winner but see Soumare as an ideal replacement if Pogba forces his way out of Old Trafford.

Lille, who are currently third in the Ligue 1 table, are hoping to tie Soumare down to a new long-term deal and value the 20-year-old at around £30m.

Moussa Dembele has also emerged as a target for the Premier League giants (Picture: Getty)

Despite their poor start to the season, Manchester United enjoyed a promising week, holding in-form Liverpool to a draw before winning in the Europa League and Premier League.

Following Sunday’s 3-1 victory over Norwich City, Solskjaer said: ‘This had been a good week for us.

‘It started with a decent performance against Liverpool and now two wins away from home. It gives the players confidence and momentum.’
